overview: Community Care Grants - money to help you set up home after leaving care or when you family is in exceptional need - what you'll get, apply, eligibility
title: Community Care Grants

table.body:
You could get a Community Care Grant to help you: 

+ set up a home after leaving residential or institutional care - eg a prison
+ stay in your home instead of going back into care 
+ help you or a family member in times of exceptional need - eg ease a domestic crisis, visit ill relatives 

How much you get depends on your circumstances - there's no set or maximum amount. 

% Any money you get doesn't have to be paid back and won't affect your other benefits. %
table.title: Overview

table.body:
There is no set or maximum amount of grant. How much money you get depends on your circumstances.

% If your savings are over £500 you'll usually get a smaller grant. % 

##How you're paid

If your application is successful the money will be paid within a week. 

All benefits, pensions and allowances are [paid into an account](/how-to-have-your-benefits-paid "How you're paid"), eg a bank account.
table.title: What you'll get

table.body:
To qualify you must get one of these benefits (or be likely to get them in the next 6 weeks): 

- Income Support
- income-related Employment and Support Allowance
- income-based Jobseeker's Allowance
- Pension Credit

Also, one of the following must apply, you: 

- are leaving residential or institutional care - eg a care home or prison 
- are being resettled into a new home by your council or a voluntary organisation following an unsettled period in your life
- are looking after someone who is ill, disabled or just out of prison
- need help to stay in your home and not go into residential care or hospital 
- need help with expenses to go to a relative's funeral or visit someone who is ill 
- need help because you or your family face exceptional pressure - eg because of a family breakdown or illness 

##Exceptions 

You can't get a grant if you've already asked for help for the same things in the last 28 days.

% You might get a [Crisis Loan](/crisis-loans "Crisis Loans") if you’re not eligible for a grant. %
table.title: Eligibility

table.body:
Send form SF300 to your local [Jobcentre Plus](http://los.direct.gov.uk/default.aspx?type=2&lang=en "Find your local Jobcentre Plus"){:rel="external"}. The form includes notes to help you fill it out. 

$D[Download 'Form SF300 - Community Care Grant and Crisis Loan applications' (PDF, 264KB)](http://www.dwp.gov.uk/advisers/claimforms/sf300_print.pdf "Download 'Form SF300 - Community Care Grant and Crisis Loan applications' (PDF, 264KB)"){:rel="external"}$D

##Appeal a decision 

You can appeal the decision about your Community Care Grant if you're unhappy with it.
